moves.1. Nf3: I'm playing white, and this is my preferred opening at present.
moves.2. c4: Rather than D4, this immediately threatens to disrupt his centre.
moves.2... dxc4 3. e3 b5: He seems keen to hold onto his slim material advantage.
moves.4. b3 cxb3 5. Bxb5+: No need to worry about the other pawn yet.
moves.5... c6 6. Bc4 bxa2 7. Nc3: There's no way he can save the pawn really, so there's no hurry to take it.
moves.8... e6 9. Rxa2 Qc7 10. O-O Nbd7: I was hoping he'd do this as he's weakened his e pawn.
moves.11. Ng5: I need back-up for my attack.
moves.11... h6: I could have backed off here, but thought it was worth going all out.
moves.12. Bxe6 fxe6: He should have taken the knight there, now he's in trouble.
moves.13. Qxe6+ Be7: King d8 loses, but then so does this!
